task.summary: Default task
More infra
placing unit tests work
Added stuff
PlayerIsWinner comes through the unit test as does isDraw Had to set the white and black queen
Created a moveHandler I created this because I thought the game class was becoming way too big.
Progression Queen move exception is being thrown when we expect it. Accidently broke move without neighbours, but fixed that in this version. Now working on repairing "move breaks tile chain".
BreakTileChain unit test doesn't work... yet. For some reason the method's, now in comments, break all the current unit tests with a nullpoint exception. Have to get back to it later.

Changed SoldierAntSpec so that the board state is valid and doesn't trigger the generic rules exception Changed SoliderAntMoveException so that it takes the super from IllegalMoveException Optimalised the tile specifice checks to retun the cell the player wants to go to. Also changed moveTile method so that it only gets the cells affected by the move and then popping the moved tile directly into the new cell it's being placed into.

SoldierAntSpec works for 2/3 test. The third one is really tricked and has to be expanded to work properly. Some of the test has been edited to follow the generic placing rules etc. The beetleMoveException has been expanded to include a message if required. The BeetleSpec is finished.
Added test to Queen tests Added constructor for SpiderMoveException Changed exception message in move tile
Expanded the grasshopper Added model for the grasshopper Seperate method for the spider and the grasshopper
The grasshopper now has method to make sure it moves into a straight line
Grasshopper unit test work Could use a unit test for the straight line, but wasn't thought of at the start.
Added unit test so that Soldier ant cannot "magically" move to the other side of the board while stuck in a board
Added gamebuilder to build the initial board and tiles each player has.
A lot of javadoc Added a unit test to placingTileSpec Added a significant amount of javadoc to the moveHandler Added a bit of javadoc to game Renamed the GameBuilder to BoardBuilder
Javadoc and started with pass
started with the pass method

Added the playHandler. The playHandler wil handle any and all processes as far as play tiles is concerned Removed method from the game method to reflect this. Also continued worked on the pass method Added javadoc to BoardBuilder
Found a new way to check the tile chain but it's still breaking every other unit test for some reason
Final correction's Realized you could get away with never playing the Queen Spider legal move wasn't working because it was adding the occupied neighbours as well.
New grasshopper exception Made a seperate exception for every mistake a grasshopper can make Pretty much everything broke afterwards
Add the exception to git Made a seperate exception for every mistake a grasshopper can make Pretty much everything broke afterwards

Fixed all the unit tests The biggest problem was that the logic of calculate distance wasn't used properly. We were calculating the distance crom the current cell to the neighbour instead of from the neighbour to the desintation.
Updated the Queen Updated the unit test for the queen. Made a test for a legal move Also tested that the queen location is updated properly.
Update the solider ant Update the solider that every situation has seperate exception
Updated the spider
Fixing the placing unit tests now
More placing stuff
New exceptions for generic rule breaking
New exceptions for generic rule breaking
refactoring so that there are less files to search through
More cleaning
Got most it working, still have to do some little work on it
Can't seem to fix the chain bug
level exception works
